meanings.definition: A pair of bones in the shoulder of most birds and reptiles.
meanings.sent1: Birds and reptiles have coracoids that help them move their wings.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian studied the coracoids of the injured bird.
meanings.sent3: The playful parrot pretended its coracoids were wings and tried to fly.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the coracoids of a soaring eagle.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased the intricate structure of coracoids in different species.

meanings.definition: The coracoid process of the scapula.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the coracoids on the X-ray to explain the injury.
meanings.sent2: During the anatomy class, the students learned about the coracoids.
meanings.sent3: The coracoids of the skeleton seemed to be waving hello.
meanings.sent4: Her shoulder pain felt like a weight pressing down on her coracoids.
meanings.sent5: The athlete felt a sharp pain in her coracoids after lifting heavy weights.
